channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Book Review: Pause to Think
item.description: This book is direct, delightful, and articulate in suggesting that we take a slow rather than fast approach to getting things thoughtfully done. It touches the minds and hearts of investment professionals.

item.title: Iranians are creating fake websites and impersonating activists to create chaos in the U.S., Microsoft found
item.description: Microsoft's report revealed its findings that suggest Iran is evolving its tactics for another election that’s likely to have global implications.

item.title: Is Illiquidity a Blessing in Disguise for Some Investors?
item.description: Rather than running away from illiquidity, investment professionals, investors, and regulators alike should recognize its potential benefits and consider a more balanced approach.

item.title: Customer service chatbots are buggy and disliked by consumers. Can AI make them better?
item.description: Speakers at Fortune Brainstorm AI Singapore shared how how they're already using AI to make customer service faster and more useful.

item.title: Scenario Planning, Foresight, and the Power of Imagination: Navigating an Uncertain Future
item.description: By fostering resilience through the consideration of various outcomes, investment practitioners can better anticipate and manage the complexities and disruptions that characterize today's dynamic environment.

item.title: VoePass plane suddenly drops from the sky and crashes in Brazil, killing all 61 on board
item.description: The aircraft involved in the crash was an ATR 72 model, a twin-engine turboprop model that typically seats about 70 people. ATR is a joint venture between Airbus SE and Italy’s Leonardo SpA.

item.title: Private Equity: In Essence, Plunder?
item.description: To understand what private equity is at its worst is a call to action, personally and professionally.

item.title: Railroad giant threatens to revoke workers’ hard-won schedule improvements
item.description: The $145 billion Union Pacific railroad offered paid sick days for the first time last year and they helped make the attendance system more manageable, but not being able to plan on their days off still takes a toll on engineers.

item.title: Small Caps, Large Caps, and Interest Rates
item.description: The relationship between stocks and interest rates is not reliably stable. There are periods when equities are highly rate sensitive, and periods when they aren't.

item.title: Biden reverses policy on weapons sales to Saudi Arabia as Mideast war upends U.S. priorities
item.description: Saudi Arabia is now deemed too important to US goals to end the Israel-Hamas war and in the growing conflict with Iran and its proxies.
